meanings.definition: The act or fact of getting rid of something
meanings.sent1: After the spring cleaning, we finally made a riddance of all the old furniture.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of riddance after breaking free from the toxic relationship.
meanings.sent3: The riddance of the old, smelly socks was a cause for celebration.
meanings.sent4: With a swift riddance, he tossed the broken vase into the trash can.
meanings.sent5: The riddance of the clutter transformed the room into a peaceful sanctuary.

meanings.definition: Relief or deliverance from something troublesome or unwanted
meanings.sent1: The rain brought a much-needed riddance from the scorching heat.
meanings.sent2: The apology offered a riddance from the tension that had been building up.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected cancellation of the meeting was a delightful riddance.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a riddance from the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music provided a temporary riddance from the stress of the day.
